Classes

class  iterator

Detailed Description

A bundle is a sequence of messages.

You stream or otherwise add your messages onto the bundle. When you want to send a group of messages (possibly just one), you tell a nub to send the bundle. Bundles can be sent multiple times to different hosts, but beware that any requests inside will also be made multiple times.

void Mercury::Bundle::startMessage ( const InterfaceElement &  ie,
ReliableType  reliable = RELIABLE_DRIVER 
)

This method starts a new message on the bundle.

The expected length should only be filled in if known (and only for variable-length messages) as a hint to whether to start this message on the current packet or to bring in a new one / send the current bundle.

Parameters:
ie The type of message to start.
reliable True if the message should be reliable.

void Mercury::Bundle::startReply ( ReplyID  id,
ReliableType  reliable = RELIABLE_DRIVER 
)

This method starts a reply to a request message.

All replies are 4-byte variable size. The first parameter, id, should be the replyID from the message header of the request you're replying to.

Parameters:
id The id of the message being replied to
reliable True if this reply should be reliable.

void Mercury::Bundle::startRequest ( const InterfaceElement &  ie,
ReplyMessageHandler *  handler,
void *  arg = NULL,
int  timeout = DEFAULT_REQUEST_TIMEOUT,
ReliableType  reliable = RELIABLE_DRIVER 
)

This method starts a new request message on the bundle, and call ReplyMessageHandler when the reply comes in or the timeout (in microseconds) expires, whichever comes first.

A timeout of <= 0 means never time out (NOT recommended)

Parameters:
ie The type of request to start.
handler This handler receives the reply.
arg User argument that is sent to the handler.
timeout Time before a timeout exception is generated.
reliable True if the message should be reliable.

void * Mercury::Bundle::startStructMessage ( const InterfaceElement &  ie,
ReliableType  reliable = RELIABLE_DRIVER 
)

Make using simple messages easier - returns a pointer the size of the message (note: not all fixed length msgs will be simple structs, so startMessage doesn't do it automatically).

void * Mercury::Bundle::startStructRequest ( const InterfaceElement &  ie,
ReplyMessageHandler *  handler,
void *  arg = NULL,
int  timeout = DEFAULT_REQUEST_TIMEOUT,
ReliableType  reliable = RELIABLE_DRIVER 
)

Make using simple requests easier - returns a pointer the size of the request message.
